intro: Melicytus micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered melicytus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy coating. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
